about.title: About Festival
about.description:
Do you love Moldova? You are not alone! You are one of us. 

 Join us at the only festival at Zimbru Stadium:
 Născut în Moldova – The Festival of Our Music.
 We invite you to sing and celebrate together everything that is ours. To take pride in and cherish everything Born in Moldova. 

Be part of our history | June 14-15 | Zimbru Stadium

rules.title: Rules
slides:
I. GENERAL PROVISIONS

1. Purpose and Scope of the Regulations

1.1. These regulations ("Regulations") establish the conditions and rules for organizing, conducting, and accessing the music festival "Born in Moldova" ("Event"), organized by the Organizer on the premises of Zimbru Stadium.

1.2. The purpose of these Regulations is to ensure safety, order, smooth conduct, and the protection of the rights of the Organizer and participants, as well as to prevent any potential risks or incidents that could affect the participants or the execution of the Event.

1.3. Organizer's Identification Details: Versus Artist SRL

2. Acceptance of the Regulations

2.1. By purchasing a ticket and/or entering the Event premises, each participant ("Participant") declares that they have read, understood, and expressly accepted all the provisions of these Regulations.

2.2. Any subsequent modifications to the Regulations will be published on the official website and/or through the Organizer's communication channels, and continued participation will constitute the Participant's acceptance of the updated version.

3. Modifications and Updates

3.1. The Organizer reserves the right to modify, supplement, or adapt these Regulations without prior notice.

3.2. The current version of the Regulations comes into effect on February 25, 2025, and applies throughout the entire duration of the Event.

II. DEFINITIONS

For the interpretation of these Regulations, the following definitions are used:

  • Ticket – A certificate issued in electronic or paper form that grants access to the Event, valid only for the specified zone and method of use.
  • Wristband – An identification and access tool issued by the Organizer during check-in, confirming ticket validity and the right to enter the Festival Zone.
  • Participants – All persons entering the Event territory and participating in organized activities who hold a valid ticket.
  • Festival Zone – The space designated by the Organizer on the Zimbru Stadium territory, including stage areas, stands, main field, food zones, and other areas.
  • Check-in – The procedure of ticket verification and access wristband issuance, performed at the entrance to the Festival Zone.

III. LEGAL RELATIONSHIP AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES

1. Contractual Relationship

1.1. These Regulations, together with any annexes and complementary policies (e.g., Privacy Policy, Personal Data Processing Policy), constitute the complete agreement between the Organizer and the Participants.

1.2. By purchasing tickets and/or accessing the Festival Area, Participants agree to fully comply with the provisions of these Regulations.

2. Organizer's Obligations

2.1. The Organizer undertakes to ensure the Event takes place under safe conditions, in accordance with applicable legal and security norms.

2.2. The Organizer will provide information points, security teams, and personnel for managing emergency situations, ensuring that Participants are informed and protected throughout the Event.

3. Participants' Obligations

3.1. Participants are required to comply with all provisions of these Regulations, as well as instructions given by the Organizer's staff and security teams.

3.2. Participants are responsible for their personal belongings brought onto the Event premises and for their behavior, acting at their own risk.

IV. TICKETS, WRISTBANDS, AND ACCESS PROCEDURES

1. Ticket Issuance and Validity

1.1. Tickets are issued exclusively through the Organizer's official channels (official website, authorized sales partners, etc.).

1.2. Tickets are non-transferable, non-exchangeable, non-resalable, and cannot be modified.

1.3. Purchasing a ticket constitutes the Participant's express agreement to all provisions of these Regulations.

2. Check-in Procedure and Wristband Issuance

2.1. Upon entering the Festival Area, Participants must undergo the check-in process, during which their ticket will be scanned and converted into an access wristband.

2.2. The wristband must be visible and worn throughout the Event. Removing, damaging, or losing the wristband will result in denied re-entry without the possibility of free replacement.

2.3. Security personnel may request an identity document to verify the Participant's identity during check-in.

3. Ticket Types

Each type of ticket grants access to specific areas (e.g., stands, main field, VIP zones, etc.), as specified on the ticket and official website. Participants must adhere to the conditions associated with their ticket type.

4. Refund and Exchange Policy

4.1. Purchased tickets are non-refundable if a refund request is made after May 14, 2025. The Organizer will not reimburse any amounts under any circumstances, except in cases of force majeure or situations provided by applicable laws.

4.2. If the Event is postponed or canceled due to force majeure, the Organizer will inform Participants and take appropriate measures as per the established norms, without incurring any additional compensation obligations.

V. ACCESS FOR CHILDREN AND MINORS

1. General Access Conditions

1.1. Children and minors may enter the Festival Area only if accompanied by an adult with a valid ticket.

1.2. Children under 7 years old are granted free entry. However, to occupy a separate seat in the stands, a ticket purchase is required.

1.3. At the entrance, the Organizer may request an identity document (birth certificate, ID) to verify the child's age.

2. Restrictions on Alcohol and Tobacco Consumption

2.1. The sale of alcoholic beverages and tobacco products to minors is strictly prohibited, in accordance with applicable laws.

2.2. Security personnel may check the age of Participants at beverage sales points.

VI. PROHIBITED AND PERMITTED ITEMS

1. Prohibited Items

To ensure the safety and smooth execution of the Event, access with the following items is prohibited (the list may be supplemented by the Organizer as necessary):

  • Prohibited substances, drugs, or psychoactive substances.
  • Dangerous objects: weapons, knives, sharp objects, blunt instruments, sprays, flammable or chemical substances.
  • Fireworks, lasers, professional filming equipment, drones, or other similar devices without prior authorization.
  • Food, beverages, alcohol, or other consumable goods.
  • Bottles, cans, glass containers, or any object that may become hazardous if broken.
  • Banners, posters, or advertising materials with offensive, racist, xenophobic, or political messages.
  • Pets (except for cases authorized by the Organizer, if applicable).

2. Permitted Items

Participants may bring reasonable personal-use items (phone, wallet, keys, etc.) and small electronic devices, provided they are of reasonable size and do not compromise safety or the proper conduct of the Event.

3. Security Checks

3.1. At the entrance, all Participants will be subject to security screenings, including searches, to identify prohibited items.

3.2. Refusal to comply with these checks may result in denial of entry to the Event premises.

VII. PARTICIPANT BEHAVIOR AND SAFETY

1. Code of Conduct

1.1. Participants must maintain a civilized and respectful attitude towards other attendees, the Organizer's staff, and security teams.

1.2. Any form of violence, harassment, vandalism, or disruptive behavior is strictly prohibited. If these provisions are violated, the Organizer reserves the right to immediately remove the offender and prohibit further access.

2. Access to Restricted Areas

2.1. Participants are not allowed to enter areas designated exclusively for the Organizer's staff or other restricted spaces (e.g., backstage areas, technical areas, stage setup zones, etc.).

2.2. Any attempt to enter these areas will be sanctioned according to these Regulations.

2.3. It is prohibited to enter the specially designated area of the stadium (main zone) with any type of food or beverages (including water) purchased or obtained from any other location. The purchase of food and water (excluding other types of beverages) is only allowed within the specially designated area of the stadium (main zone) at the officially designated commercial points inside this zone.

3. Emergency Procedures

3.1. In case of an emergency, Participants must follow the instructions of security personnel and proceed to the marked emergency exits within the Festival Area.

3.2. The Organizer will provide first aid stations and emergency response teams, and Participants are encouraged to cooperate in evacuation procedures or other safety measures.

VIII. ALCOHOL CONSUMPTION, SMOKING, AND COMMERCIAL ACTIVITIES

1. Alcohol Consumption

1.1. The sale and consumption of alcohol are permitted only to individuals aged 18 or older, who must present an identity document at sales points.

1.2. Excessive alcohol consumption that leads to disruptive behavior is prohibited. The Organizer reserves the right to refuse the sale of alcohol and/or entry to individuals who are visibly intoxicated.

2. Smoking

2.1. Smoking is only allowed in designated smoking areas.

2.2. Smoking in covered areas or restricted access zones is strictly prohibited.

3. Commercial Activities

3.1. Participants are not allowed to conduct commercial or advertising activities at the Event without prior written consent from the Organizer.

3.2. Any activity involving the distribution of flyers, samples, or other promotional materials without prior approval will be sanctioned and may result in removal from the Event premises.

IX. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND CLEANLINESS

1. Environmental Protection

1.1. Participants must respect the environment and refrain from damaging the infrastructure, grass, and green areas of Zimbru Stadium.

1.2. Any act of vandalism or damage to public property will be sanctioned according to applicable laws, and the Organizer reserves the right to seek compensation.

2. Cleanliness

2.1. Throughout the Event, Participants must use designated waste bins and recycling points.

2.2. The Organizer will conduct periodic cleaning operations, and Participants are encouraged to contribute to maintaining a clean and safe environment.

X. SERVICES, PRODUCTS, AND PAYMENT METHODS

1. Available Products and Services

1.1. Various services and products (food, beverages, merchandise, etc.) will be available at designated locations within the Event.

1.2. All services will be offered in compliance with legal regulations and the conditions established by the Organizer.

2. Payment Methods

2.1. Payment for products and services will be made exclusively using the payment methods accepted by the Organizer (cash, card, electronic payment systems, etc.).

2.2. The use of any payment methods other than the officially communicated ones is strictly prohibited.

XI. PHOTO, VIDEO, AND IMAGE RIGHTS

1. Image Rights

1.1. Participants are informed that their presence at the Event may be recorded (video, audio) and photographed.

1.2. Materials (photos and videos) taken by the Organizer and/or its partners may be used for promotional, advertising, and informational purposes without requiring additional consent from Participants.

2. Restrictions on the Use of Filming Equipment

2.1. The use of professional filming or photography equipment is prohibited without prior accreditation issued by the Organizer.

XII. PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION

1. Data Processing

1.1. By participating in the Event, Participants agree to the processing of their personal data by the Organizer, in accordance with the Privacy Policy published on the official website.

1.2. Participants have the right to access, rectify, or request the deletion of their data in accordance with relevant legal provisions.

2. Data Security

2.1. The Organizer undertakes to protect Participants' personal data and not to disclose it to third parties without prior consent, except in cases provided by law.

XIII. LIMITATION OF THE ORGANIZER'S LIABILITY

1. Liability Exclusions

1.1. Participation in the Event is at the Participant's own risk.

1.2. The Organizer shall not be responsible for the loss, theft, or damage of Participants' personal belongings.

1.3. The Organizer does not assume responsibility for incidents, accidents, or damages of any nature suffered by Participants, except in cases where gross negligence on the part of the Organizer can be proven.

1.4. In cases of force majeure or unforeseen circumstances (e.g., extreme weather conditions, strikes, pandemics, acts of terrorism, etc.), the Organizer will be exempt from any liability, and Participants assume these risks.

X}V. DISPUTES AND APPLICABLE LAW

1. Dispute Resolution

1.1. Any dispute arising in connection with the interpretation, application, or execution of these Regulations shall be resolved amicably.

1.2. If an amicable resolution fails, disputes will be subject to the competent courts of the Republic of Moldova, in accordance with applicable Moldovan law.

2. Applicable Law

2.1. These Regulations are governed by the laws of the Republic of Moldova.

2.2. Any interpretation of its provisions shall be made in accordance with common law principles and general legal norms.

XIV. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

1. Exclusive Rights

All intellectual property rights, including copyrights, trademarks, designs, images, video materials, texts, graphics, and any other content published on the official website or used within the Event, belong exclusively to the Organizer or authorized rights holders.

2. Restricted Use

Without prior written consent from the Organizer (or the rights holders), the reproduction, distribution, modification, publication, or commercial exploitation of any protected materials is strictly prohibited. Any unauthorized use will constitute a violation of intellectual property rights and will be subject to legal sanctions.

XVI. THIRD-PARTY LIABILITY AND CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS

1. Third-Party Services and Products

The Organizer assumes no responsibility for the execution or non-execution of contractual obligations by service providers, vendors, or other third parties selling products or providing services within the Festival Area for a fee.

2. Direct Responsibility of Third Parties

The quality, availability, and compliance of products and services offered by third parties are their direct responsibility. Any complaint or compensation request related to these aspects must be addressed directly to the respective provider, as the Organizer is not a party to contractual relationships between third parties and Participants.

XVII. ADDITIONAL RELEVANT CLAUSES

1. Support, Complaints, and Information Requests

Any complaints, information requests, or suggestions should be addressed to the designated information points within the Event premises or via the official contact address.

The Organizer undertakes to respond to complaints within the timeframes stipulated by applicable law.

2. Final Additional Provisions

Any inconsistency between the provisions of this set of additional clauses and other Event documents shall be resolved in favor of this text, except in cases imposed by law.

This set of clauses is binding for all Participants, without affecting the validity of other provisions.

faq.question: Are there age restrictions?
faq.answer:
✔️ Yes, festival access is allowed as follows:

  • For persons 16 years and older – can purchase tickets and attend the festival independently.
  • For persons under 16 – must be accompanied by an adult.

faq.question: Can I buy tickets on-site? How can I pay?
faq.answer:
✔️ Yes, tickets can be purchased on-site. Payment can be made in cash or by card.

✔️ Until the festival, tickets are available online at afisha.md.

faq.question: Will there be toilets and a cloakroom?
faq.answer:
✔️ Yes, festival attendees will have access to toilets – which will be available at the Zimbru Stadium.

❌ There will be no cloakroom, and storage of unattended personal items will not be possible.

faq.question: Will food and water be available for purchase?
faq.answer:
✔️ Yes, there will be food and beverage vendors.​

⚠️ Restrictions:

  • In the grass area – only still water is allowed.
  • In the stands area – food and drinks are allowed.

faq.question: How long will the festival last?
faq.answer:
✔️ Open Doors: 12:00 / 13:00 (exact time to be announced later).

✔️ Festival ends at: 00:00 (midnight)

faq.question: Will there be parking spaces?
faq.answer:
❌ No

✔️ Attendees are advised to plan their transportation accordingly.

faq.question: How can I get to the festival?
Will there be security and medical assistance?
faq.answer: ✔️ Yes, security services and medical assistance will be provided throughout the festival.

faq.question: What can I bring to the festival?
faq.answer:
✔️ A good mood! 😃​

❌ Prohibited items:

  • Food and drinks brought from outside.
  • Dangerous items (see festival rules).

faq.question: How can I pay for products at the festival?
faq.answer: ✔️ All purchases at the festival can be paid for in cash or by card.

faq.question: Will official merchendise (t-shirts, caps, etc.) be available?
faq.answer: ✔️ Yes, official festival merchandise (t-shirts, caps, accessories) will be available for purchase.

faq.question: Are there any passes for families, friends, or groups?
faq.answer:
✔️ Yes, there are special packages and subscriptions for groups.

✔️ Prices and details are available on the website and on afisha.md.

faq.question: What happens if the festival is postponed?
faq.answer:
✔️ If the festival is cancelled – ticket refunds will be issued.

✔️ If the festival is rescheduled – purchased tickets will remain valid for the new date.
